fields.summary: DFSStripedOutputStream#close will throw if called a second time with a failed streamer

comments.body: Add a test to verify the bug, and only logs remaining IOE from {{streams}} after close() being called.

Change looks pretty simple :) Did you dig up any info on the history of this code? I find it strange that it goes to all this work to explicitly re-throw the error like this. Even logging again is unnecessary, as long as it logs the first time.

Discussed offline with Andrew.  Now we consider if there are more than {{dataUnits}} streamer success, then the {{OutputStream}} is success.  Also move the {{lastException}} to {{DFSStripedOutputStream}} that can be set by {{abort()}}.

Thanks for working on this Eddy, looks good overall, though we should address the findbugs/checkstyle.

Might also consider splitting LastException (or whatever we rename it to) into a new a class, since it's no longer used by just the DataStreamer.

Thanks for the suggestions [~andrew.wang]

Updated to fix findbugs and checkstyle warnings, and also extract the {{LastException}} to a new class {{ExceptionLastSeen}} (choosing this name to avoid findbugs warning).
